meanings.definition: A mental impression or representation of an object perceived by the senses.
meanings.sent1: Her percept of the sunset was filled with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent2: The artist's percept of the landscape inspired his painting.
meanings.sent3: His percept of the noisy cat as a lion made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The percept of time slipping away can be unsettling.
meanings.sent5: The percept of fear in her eyes was unmistakable.

meanings.sent1: The beautiful flower was the percept that caught her attention.
meanings.sent2: His percept of the distant mountain guided their journey.
meanings.sent3: The lost key became a percept of frustration for him.
meanings.sent4: The percept of success motivated him to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The percept of kindness in his actions was heartwarming.
